name: places/ChIJwXfsrldYwokR_gi9Y1q0f2Q
adrFormatAddress: 851 8th Ave, New York, NY 10019, USA

editorialSummary.text: Vintage-influenced rooms & suites in a hip hotel featuring a cafe, a cocktail bar & a gym.

originalText.text:
I read many reviews before booking this room and they weren't lying when they said that this was a quiet place to stay. We were wonderfully surprised at how quiet it was considering how close we were to so many NYC attractions.
The room was also quite spacious. My only complaint was that there wasn't a coffee machine in the room.
Quiet, cozy, conveniently located with a great atmosphere. The lounge was very inviting. The service was wonderful.
The parking was also conviently attached to he hotel.
All in all,.I'd definitely recommend Romer Hell's Kitchen!

originalText.text: Stayed in late September when they were doing a slow opening. Hotel is new and has been renovated so everything was very clean and nice. Housekeeping were very kind and friendly. My only complaint was no extractor fan in the bathroom so the room got humid after a warm shower. Great location, so convenient to everything but also far enough away from the chaos of Times Square. I would definitely stay again.

text.text: Stayed in late September when they were doing a slow opening. Hotel is new and has been renovated so everything was very clean and nice. Housekeeping were very kind and friendly. My only complaint was no extractor fan in the bathroom so the room got humid after a warm shower. Great location, so convenient to everything but also far enough away from the chaos of Times Square. I would definitely stay again.

originalText.text: Best hotel stay I've had in a long time! Very safe, family-friendly environment. Hotel staff were kind and welcoming. Rooms were nice and clean. I do agree with the other review that suggested the need for an exhaust fan in the bathroom, but overall, the room was great. Super convenient location…very close walking distance to many attractions and a subway station is only one block away. I would definitely stay here again!

text.text: Best hotel stay I've had in a long time! Very safe, family-friendly environment. Hotel staff were kind and welcoming. Rooms were nice and clean. I do agree with the other review that suggested the need for an exhaust fan in the bathroom, but overall, the room was great. Super convenient location…very close walking distance to many attractions and a subway station is only one block away. I would definitely stay here again!

originalText.text: Loved my stay at the Romer! Staff were 10/10, room was a typical hotel room with decent space and comfortable beds. The atmosphere and location were great. My only complaint (minor) is that the lobby and my room were warmer than I wanted, so I felt like I was too warm most of the trip. I would still come back and stay again!

text.text: Loved my stay at the Romer! Staff were 10/10, room was a typical hotel room with decent space and comfortable beds. The atmosphere and location were great. My only complaint (minor) is that the lobby and my room were warmer than I wanted, so I felt like I was too warm most of the trip. I would still come back and stay again!

originalText.text: Me and my fiancé stayed here last week and loved it. We did tons of research on hotels in the area and decided on this one based on location for things we wanted to walk to. Perfect walking distance to most Broadway shows & Times Square. Not a bad walk to Central Park and Penn Station! Our room was super clean and the bed was very comfortable. The only small issue I ran into was no conditioner in the shower (just 2 shampoos and 1 body wash) and the water in the shower was hot but inconsistent. We had the room right by the elevator and we had no issue with the noise (we had our AC on full blast to cover any possible noise). I would stay here again when we return! We had a city view and it was mostly facing a building next door with a partial city view if you stand at the right angle. We weren’t really concerned by this. Thanks Romer for a great stay!
